cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper deals with the task of abstract screening in systematic reviews, which involves using machine learning methods to automatically exclude irrelevant citations based on their titles and abstracts. This task is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including information retrieval (cs.IR), natural language processing (cs.CL), machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI), and deep learning (cs.DL). Given that the paper focuses on evaluating SVM-based methods for this task, it is most likely to be classified under cs.IR, which is the sub-category that deals with information retrieval techniques. However, the paper's relevance to other sub-fields of computer science suggests that it could also be classified under cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, or cs.DL.
